title: Kernel.Abstractions Module & Transport Signal Promotions
desc: Foundational module expansion: HoneyDrunk.Kernel.Abstractions added as the first Kernel module slotâ€”defining core interfaces, contracts, and zero-dependency abstractions that underpin the entire Grid. Positioned as the 'contracts' slot with deep integration depth and stable tier, Abstractions establishes explicit boundaries between layers and provides dependency injection contracts for Vault, Transport, Telemetry, Pulse, and all Core modules. With signal=Live matching parent Kernel, this module represents the bedrock interface definitions now powering production infrastructure. Simultaneously promoted all three Transport adapter modules to Live: InMemory (shallow integration, dev/test harness), StorageQueues (medium integration, Azure queue adapter), and AzureServiceBus (deep integration, pub/sub with topics/sessions). These promotions reflect Transport's production-ready status across all supported messaging backends. Signal quote from Abstractions: 'The contracts that connect the Grid.' This work solidifies Kernel as the architectural foundation with explicit module slots while acknowledging Transport's maturity across in-memory, cloud queue, and enterprise service bus patterns.

title: HoneyDrunk.Clarity Manifested â€” The Hive's Human Interface
desc: HoneyDrunk.Clarity (Flow: 24) joins the Grid as the AI sector's first human-facing companionâ€”an in-studio guide wired directly into the Hive's intelligence. Clarity is context-aware across code editors, DCC tools (Blender, Photoshop), and game engines, providing precise answers rooted in HoneyDrunk.Kernel patterns, Standards rules, and Meta.AtlasSync knowledge. Unlike generic copilots, Clarity understands your active stackâ€”repo, scene, file, taskâ€”and surfaces guidance from AgentKit, Pulse telemetry, Vault configs, and HoneyHub workflows in real time. Built for indie devs and small studios drowning in tabs and documentation, Clarity bridges tools through a single assistant surface: ask about C# best practices, Unity pipeline issues, or deployment flows without leaving your workspace. Phase 1 targets VS Code/JetBrains/VS extensions with HoneyDrunk-native intelligence; Phase 2 adds cross-tool overlays and team memory; Phase 3 couples with Operator/VEE for automated fixes. Dependencies: AgentKit (agent lifecycle), Pulse (context/telemetry), Vault (secure config), Meta.AtlasSync (synchronized knowledge), Standards (patterns), HoneyHub (task integration). Monetization path: core experience free or bundled with HoneyHub; Pro tiers for studios with private knowledge ingestion, org policies, multi-seat management, and telemetry insights. Signal quote: 'Know what to do next, wherever you are.' Clarity transforms the Grid from infrastructure into conversation.

title: Infrastructure Expansion â€” Collector, Comms, and Assets Join the Grid

HoneyDrunk.Assets (Flow: 57) provides centralized storage for digital artifacts with Vault encryption, signed URL delivery, and content-addressed versioning. All three nodes integrate deeply with existing infrastructure: depending on Vault for auth, Transport for event relay, and Pulse for metrics. Collector and Assets land in Ops and Core respectively, establishing foundation for observability SaaS and secure media delivery patterns. BuildLog component deployed to node detail pages, surfacing recent signals and updates for improved discoverability. Package updates applied: Next.js 16.0.0â†’16.0.1, React 19.1.0â†’19.2.0, Tailwind 4.1.14â†’4.1.17, @types/node upgraded ^20â†’^22 for Vercel compatibility.

With standardized testing, packaging, and deployment pipelines, Actions bridges closed-source craft and open-source community. Simultaneously overhauled flow cooldown mechanics to dramatically deprioritize completed work: (1) Cooldown multipliers reduced from 0.6/0.8 to 0.02/0.05 for priority/energy, applying 98% penalty to done nodes. (2) Implemented hard cap system in compute-flow.js â€” any done node automatically capped at Flow â‰¤ 45 regardless of centrality or foundational status. (3) Foundational floor guardrail disabled (percentile: 70 â†’ 0) to prevent lifting completed nodes. (4) Kernel and Standards both dropped from Flow 73 to 45, clearing space for active development. Flow Index now accurately reflects active roadmap: Actions (94), Transport (90), Data (86), Vault (80) lead active work, while completed Kernel and Standards sit at 45. Architecture enables completed foundational nodes to fade from priority view while remaining part of the Grid's history.

title: Flow Physics Overhaul â€” SCC-Aware Prioritization
desc: Fixed two critical issues bending the Flow computation: (1) Ops bootstrap boost reduced from +80 to +20â€”was warping the map and letting Ops permanently eclipse Core foundational nodes. (2) Implemented Tarjan's algorithm for strongly connected components (SCCs) to handle 27 circular dependencies. Ancestor override now works on the acyclic SCC DAG, with smart normalization inside cycles (foundational nodes get maxPriority - 5, others equalize). Updated 10 key nodes with tuned time_pressure and strategy_base parameters. Results: Kernel (100) and Vault (100) now anchor the top, Transport (85) and Web.Rest (82) follow as foundational, Pipelines (80) holds reasonable position. Foundational nodes exempt from WIP sequencing penalties. Core physics now stableâ€”bootstrap gives temporary lift without permanent throne, cycles handled gracefully.
